title: AFL trades 2019: AFL trade period winner, St Kilda, Dougal Howard, Paddy Ryder, Bradley Hill, Zak Jones, Dan Butler
text:
St Kilda is having “one of the great trade periods we’ve seen in a decade” with two players already joining the club and three more likely to arrive on Wednesday.

The Saints made their first big move on Tuesday when they sent Picks 12 and 18, plus a future third-round pick, to Port Adelaide in exchange for Paddy Ryder, Dougal Howard, Pick 10 and a future fourth-round pick.

That was set up by last week’s pick swap in which St Kilda gained 12 and 18 from GWS in exchange for picks 6 and 59.

Now Pick 10 is expected to be the centrepiece of a deal for Fremantle star Bradley Hill, with Blake Acres flying west to consider whether he’ll join the Dockers and help the deal along.

In essence, the Saints will be swapping Picks 6 and 59, a future third-round pick and potentially a second-round pick, for Bradley Hill, Paddy Ryder and Dougal Howard.

POTENTIAL BRADLEY HILL TRADE

Fremantle gets: Pick 10, future second-round pick, Blake Acres

St Kilda gets: Brad Hill and late picks

The Saints are also set to add Zak Jones from Sydney in exchange for a second-round pick while Richmond’s Dan Butler may also join the club.

“I think this has been awesome work by St Kilda,” dual premiership Kangaroo David King said on Fox Footy’s Trading Day.

“(List manager) James Gallagher has done a fantastic job.

“They’ve got him (Bradley Hill) effectively for going back four picks, from 6 to 10, and for a future second rounder - which is in a weak pool next year.

“We know 2020 is going to be a heavily compromised draft. And maybe the numbers don’t really equate, at this stage, as to what the talent you’re actually going to get.”

Nicks signs 3 year deal 9:51

King described Dougal Howard as a “potential All-Australian”, while Herald Sun journalist Jon Ralph was also full of praise for the Saints’ work.

“This is one of the great trade periods we’ve seen in a decade,” he said.

“James Gallagher comes in, a first-year list manager, right now Dougal Howard for a decade, Jones and Hill as A-graders, they’ll get Ryder and Butler as well.

“It’s an exceptional trade period.”

Hawks make Giant move 0:27

St Kilda champion Leigh Montagna was on the same page.

“I think it’s a great win for St Kilda,” he said of the trade with Port Adelaide.

“Dougal Howard, 200 centimetres, athletic intercept defender. Probably what St Kilda really need, Nathan Brown’s getting late in his career, Jake Carlisle also.

“I think it’s a great get and really ... they haven’t given up a great deal to get these players. I think Gallagher and Simon Lethlean have done a great job.”

Emotional return for Betts 2:30

While Blake Acres has shown potential at the Saints, most agree he’s yet to live up to it, which means if he heads to Fremantle it could be the best scenario for both parties.

“If Jack Martin has been the number one tease in the AFL, then this bloke in Blake Acres is on the podium,” Ralph said.

“For that reason - only two Brownlow votes in 75 games - if you’re a St Kilda fan, you’ll think, I just don’t think we’re ever going to see the best of him.

“He might well flourish at another football club.”
